10. Also, in your cartoon, so as not to err,
you should incorporate much from life,
enhanced and deepened
with watercolor, chalk or charcoal, all commanded
at your choice, and at your will:
but if you wish to give your compositions
pleasingly fine [and] good vigor,
you must take note of various things.
right-middleUse details from life in drawing cartoons.

11. First you should discover by exploring
the proper foundation in your composition:
when you adroitly fill your scene
on both sides with your bold
foreground figures, buildings, and other staffage,
and keep the center free and open
so as to add as little as possible,
this will achieve success later on.
right-middleFill in the corners well on both sides.

12. Our composition should enjoy
a fine character, to our sense of satisfaction,
if we allow a view inside, or a vista
with small background figures, and a distant
landscape into which the eye can plunge.
Therefore in the middle of the foreground
we can have our figures sometimes sit or lie down
so that we can see over them for several miles.
right-middle On allowing a view through, where appropriate.

13. But in particular, we will end up with little grace
in our composition if our backgrounds
are other than well executed.
For this purpose the Italians employ us
As foreigners from abroad, since they regard Netherlanders
as bold experts in landscape painting
–if they are to exalt us in anything–
while they surpass us in painting figures.
right-middleIf the backgrounds or landscapes are not well executed, the work is disfigured.

14. One should still try in various ways
to compose well, and spend some time
patiently, especially to avoid haste,
arranging all the figures as you must:
like the Italians, who greatly celebrate
composition in various groups,
which their little knots or bands of people, to wit:
here standing, there lying down, and there sitting.
right-middle Of composing in various knots [of figures], and leaving some ground in between.

15. Here is a battle of terrible skirmishes;
one group should be in the distance, fleeing elsewhere,
right-middle Example of a walking pose, or a weary figure.
